title: nt.number theory - What is the order of binary partition function when number of partitions is fixed?
body: Given a number $N$ , the number of ways to write it as a sum of powers of $2$ is called the binary partition function of $N$ and is well studied. But if the number partitions are fixed, then how do you write the number $N$ as the sum of $k$ powers of $2$ , that is, are there are any known upper and lower bounds for number of partitions? nt.number-theory co.combinatorics analytic-number-theory Share Cite Improve this question Follow edited Jul 21, 2020 at 11:15 vidyarthi 2,145 1 1 gold badge 17 17 silver badges 24 24 bronze badges asked Jul 20, 2020 at 18:59 Rishi Gajjala 11 1 1 bronze badge $\endgroup$ 1 $\begingroup$ See OEIS A089052 . $\endgroup$ Max Alekseyev –  Max Alekseyev 2020-07-21 18:32:56 +00:00 Commented Jul 21, 2020 at 18:32 Add a comment  |  0 Sorted by: Reset to default Highest score (default) Date modified (newest first) Date created (oldest first) You must log in to answer this question.
